Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy's coming back today! Andy's coming back today! Ha! Andy's coming back today. David Wallace sent him on an outward bound wilderness adventure for a whole month to make him more decisive and confident. He sent his own son too. And the counselors said they both grew up, big time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How was my summer? It was pretty mixed. I invented a new power drink made out of beet runoff. Mmm, mmm! So that's really good. But I got some disappointing medical news.

Quote.Speaker: Doctor
Quote.Text: Mr. Schrute, the results are in. You are not the father.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I told you [Dwight vomits power drink on Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, what a summer! An emotional roller-coaster. I ran over a turtle in the parking lot, but then I saved him by gluing his shell back together. But I'm not that good at puzzles.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [as Kevin reassembles shell] That piece doesn't go there. [Kevin shushes him]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: So I patched him with stuff from around the office. But I couldn't get the pieces to fit right. Then one day, when I was reaching for the glue, I crushed his shell again. But I rebuilt him even better that time. But it turned out the turtle was already day. Probably when I ran over him the first time.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: For us, um, nothing new, really the kids are great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You are really good at modesty. She's a genius. She painted this incredible mural in the kids' room. There's a hippo leading a parade of 500 children--

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kay, well, you had that interesting thing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, Jim's friend is starting anew company based on this idea Jim had when they were back in college.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Its sports marketing basically. But the athletes are partners.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And he wanted Jim to be a part of it too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: In Philly, so, that doesn't really work for the family. Watch this guy make a billion dollars off my idea.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He said if it takes off he's gonna buy us a new car.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: An Altima or better.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Kelly Kapoor is gone. Her fiancé Ravi was hired as a pediatrics professor at Miami university.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [tossing out winter coats] I don't need em anymore. I am going to Miami biotches. To hang with Lebron James and Gloria Estefan.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Miami University in Ohio. On her last day, Kelly was still a little confused about it

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Enjoy the snow losers.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I'm so happy for you Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Shortly after Kelly left, Ryan quit and also moved to Ohio, for what he claimed were unrelated reasons.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I've actually done a lot of market research and it actually turns out that southwestern Ohio is going to be the next Silicon Valley. They call it the Silicon Prairie. It's a big university town. And, uh, that's not garbage, it's out clothes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And that was our summer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: we good?

Quote.Speaker: Off-camera
Quote.Text: Yeah

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't you guys have everything. I mean, its just a paper company.

Quote.Speaker: Off-camera
Quote.Text: Well we're more following you guys, to see how you turn out.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, because we were kind of dramatic in the beginning. Well I don't think anything's gonna change in our lives now. With work and two kids there's just-nothing interesting is going to happen for us in a long, long time.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy's coming back today!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hey, uh, does anybody know where we throw these out?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Oh, my god. It's called a garbage can.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Helpless.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: There's two new guys back there with me now. They're in their 20s. And we really get along.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: [Playing computer game with Toby] You're looking good.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Just three single guys. Getting into trouble.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: They're like the new Jim and Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, yes, yes I see that! Perfect.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey, new Jim, come sit on my face.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: No thank you. My name's Pete.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, Pete is not the new Jim. The only we have in common is that neither of us wants to sit on Meredith's face. And if that makes him the new Jim, then every human being in the world is the new Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy's here! Old Dwight, new Dwight, Andy's here. New Jim, Tuna, Andy's here. Pam, he's here. [squeals as Andy walks in]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey! Wow, I thought about this place a lot when I was on solo. Three days on a mountain, it'll change you. The things we think we need. Clocks, yeah right!

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: It sounds amazing, tell us all about it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What're you still doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Wonderful, thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know I had this really funny dream during Outward Bound that you died.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Brilliant.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: See me in my office later. The new guys, alright. It's Clark and, um--

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Pete!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: In Outward Bound it was all about nicknames. They called me Iceman. You will be called Plop.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: What? Why?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Cause you're always taking dumps.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: No I'm not.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on, everybody defecates. Relax, Plop. And you will be called Fart cause you fart all the time.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I love it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Actually, Andy, we call this one Dwight, Jr.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: No, I prefer Fart.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No, Dwight Jr. Infinitely better. You guys look exactly alike. Dwight go stand next to him. This is insane.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't see it.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I don't either.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Whoa! Mind blown. It's like father and son! Dwight, you cool if we call him Dwight Jr?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, yes I am. [puts his arm around Clark]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight, Jr! [Dwight gives Clark a noogie]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In a way it's like I have a son. And who knows? Maybe someday they'll hire someone who looks like a younger version of him. And then I'll have a grandson.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Well, I need to give my cat up for adoption.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The one who uses the doorbell, or the one with the Mexican hat, or the one with the rain galoshes, or the one you let go around naked?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Angela's cats are cute. So cute that you just want to eat them. But you can't eat cats. You can't eat cats, Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, the one with the long hair and the denim pants, Comstock! Ok, look [starts playing video on computer]. He's such a special kitty. I just want to find him a good home. He loves those pants

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'll take him.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Please, after the turtle?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I am enormously proud of what I did for that turtle!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oscar, Oscar, will you take him?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No, I'm a dog person.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: If you pray enough, you can change yourself into a cat person.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Those guys always change back, Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: David, outward bound was incredible. I was the best at slack lining, I ate a worm.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Glad to hear it. You sound very confident and decisive.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey you wanted to see me?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, I gotta go David. [hangs up phone] Why is Nellie still here?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You can only fire Nellie for cause.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mm, then I will make up a cause.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Except you just told me you were gonna make it up. Now if she sues, I have to testify against you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Then forget I just told you that.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Can't. I took a course at the Weintraub Memory Academy. I sat next to this woman named Beverly Brook. She had a Greek salad for lunch. See what I mean?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now I know why Michael hated you so much.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Good boy, getting big and strong. Snack foods!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yep, body by Cheez-it

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah, humor. I have it too. I have a couple tickets to the slayer concert 10 months from now. You interested?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I think I'm busy that night. Or I would.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well, we're both just kinda learning as we go, aren't we?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Learning what?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Just how this going to be, you know? You have a beautiful round head.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So what kind of farming you into, huh? You more of a fruit man or a root man?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Is this--is this like code for gay stuff? Cause if so, that's totally fine. Like, I'm fine with it. But you should know that I'm into the ladies.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Spoken like a true root man.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You know, if you're ever swamped, I could make some sales calls for you.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My calls?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So could you give me a list of all your clients? Or just the leads that you haven't had time to pursue yet?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You want a list of my clients? You want my leads?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'll just give it a glance--

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I'll give it a read.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: With my leads and stuff like that?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Cause you're interested in going into sales?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I am.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wow, that's great. That's great. Ok, good, let's talk about that, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're not getting my clients! Nice try.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Paranoid? I'm not familiar with the word. And I really don't have time to learn new words right now, ok? A pudgy 22-year-old is trying to take my job.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, get ready for the battle of your life.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Done. Explain.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The new guys. Dwight Jr is after my job. Yeah. There is a shark hiding inside that adorable little cherub.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, now I get what Pete was talking about at the sales meeting yesterday.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, sales--what sales meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The new guys called one.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The new guys called a sales meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Clark ended the whole thing with a karate demonstration. Did you know there was a belt above black?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's no belt above black. Is there a belt above black?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You should ask him. It's a color you would never expect. [Dwight storms off] Too easy.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Attention everyone. Comstock is still available. Oscar has been flirting with adopting him. But still hasn't given me a definite yes or no.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Definitely no.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Fine. For any interested candidates, I will be conducting 20 minute interviews. My ideal situation would an independently wealthy cute couple with a strong commitment to education. Black or white, I'm fine with either, but not both. [to Pam] Listen, you're in this, but you need to wow me, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I wanted to talk to you about our working relationship this year. It's going to be terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Not necessarily

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No I'm going to make sure that it is. And if it isn't, I'm going to take immediate action to rectify that. Now, I don't like to throw around the b-word, but I'm going to be a huge bitch to you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Now this is called slack lining.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I set up the old slack line to teach the office the skills of focus and discipline. Or in the case of certain individuals, the skills of humiliation and looking really dumb.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: If you make it all the way across, your confidence will soar. But, if you Toby out, then you'll feel like a real Nellie. How about a hand, screw those guys. Now, these are my actual Outward Bound counselors, Rafe and Feather.

Quote.Speaker: Rafe
Quote.Text: Iceman.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's me. The powder is for your protection, Feather has permanent athlete's foot. Feather, show them how you dance upon the line of slack.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You a sports fan?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Sure, boxing, tennis.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh. Any team sports?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: NASCAR. The Amazing Race.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Phillies fan, though, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: You mean horses?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, like baseball. A baseball team.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Ah, I like the Red Sox. I'm from Vermont.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok. Good talk.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have nothing in common with Plop.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All right, who's next? Nellie?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, I would rather watch you and your talented friends.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nonsense. Get up here.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Go ahead

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on. Uh, are you gonna wear your heels?

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: I'm very self-conscious about my feet.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok, sure. There ya go. Atta girl. Hey, alright. Whoa! [pushes Nellie off slack line] You suck. Alright, who's next? Darryl?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This seems like the kind of thing white people with dreadlocks do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dwight Jr? This looks like your speed.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Uh, I guess I could give it shot.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, come on. Get up here. Just hop on up.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Ok

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Focus on the horizon. [Clark successfully walks the slack line] Whoa! Look at this guy.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I've always been good at anything that required balance. My doctor says I have gigantic inner ears.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Go, Dwight Jr!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Boo, unimpressed. It's a tightrope for babies. Boo!

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Alright, let's see you do it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright. Let me show you how a real man walks across a flaccid cord.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ooh! Who ordered the hot apple fail?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, I am just getting started, ok?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You got this, it's all you. [as Dwight repeatedly fails and gets smacked around] Got ourselves a yard sale. Balls in face. It's not a race, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well it's official. Old Dwight is lame and New Dwight is cool.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [bleeding heavily from the mouth] That's not true. Just give me another chance.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: But your mouth is ble--

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This is a bloodbath. Alright, I'm calling this.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It is enough of this. Everyone, let's go back to work.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is a stupid activity. I would be embarrassed to be good at it. [tries to go in locked door] Idiots.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Slack lining, please. Untie that rope, give it to a couple of pig-tailed school girls, let them start jumping with it while chanting a rhyme and giggling about boys. Doesn't seem so macho now, does it? It's a jump rope!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam? Hey come up here, up the ladder. Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [sees trapeze contraption] What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come here, I'll show you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Why do you want this cat?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I don't want it, really.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: How would you support the cat? What are your ambitions?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I want to start my own business. I want to be a millionaire. Lots of things. Travel, make the world a better place, earn an MBA at night.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Have you taken any concrete steps?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Well, I'm still just fitting in here, you know? Getting used to the new job. But, definitely on the agenda. But that is a good idea, Angela. I should make a list.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, come on, Pete! God, that's just sad. If he doesn't watch himself, he's gonna be here for years, doing nothing. [sober realization] Wow, maybe Pete is the new Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you see how the trapeze completely surrounds the wire? That means it's literally impossible for anyone to fall off. So you will merely sit below and be my counterweight as I pedal across the parking lot to that telephone pole.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I will?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You will. Yeah we weigh about the same, wouldn't you say?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure, if you weigh 105 pounds.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So you'll do it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on, this will be the only thrill of your boring life.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, you may find this hard to believe, but I love my boring life.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Exactly the way it is.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes, and there's nothing you could say that would get me to run the slightest risk of losing it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Please? Please, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Find someone else, I don't know. Ask Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I can't use Phyllis. Are you kidding me? The moment she steps off this bar I'll be launched into space. God, you're so insensitive.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Why are you getting rid of it?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Allergies.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Your husband?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, the baby. Please, it's my husband's favorite cat. He's broken up about it. It's the only time I've seen him cry other than our wedding night.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You know what? I will take Comstock.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Really? Oh, Oscar, thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll come by after work and pick him up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yay! Oh, poor Robert. He won't get to say goodbye. He has this business dinner tonight

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: C'est la vie.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Please don't teach the cat French.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [on phone] Yeah. Good news, tonight when you come over for dinner, you can play with your old buddy Comstock.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You ready?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. You know what? I'll meet you down there. Just gotta make a quick call.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Kay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. [prepares bike trapeze]Oh, god.

Quote.Speaker: Description
Quote.Text: [Jim tries dialing and hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Attention, employees of Dunder Mifflin. Everyone thinks the new guys are so cool cause they can slack line. Boo. Hey Clark, this is what a areal salesman looks like. They say that you only live once and I'm about to prove it. Dwight Schrute!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, man. It's halpert. Did you go to the other guy yet? Great, don't. I'm in. Yeah, yep, I'm all in. Ok, talk to you soon. Bye. [hangs up] Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Woo! [starts pedaling out until trapeze bike flips over, he dangles from the handlebars] Ahh!!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: In the parking lot today there was a circus. The copier did tricks on the high-wire, a lady tried to give away a baby that looked like a cat. There was a Dwight impersonator and a Jim impersonator; a strong man crushed a turtle. I laughed and I cried. Not bad for a day in the life of a dog food company.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Crap. Sorry, Nellie.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Once again, I understand that old habits die hard, but if everyone would kindly walk their refuse to the trash bins instead of tossing them, then we would--[hit in the face with trash]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Mm, swish.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh, it's nothing to do with me. I just happen to be sitting near to where the bins are.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There are two things that I am passionate about. Recycling and revenge.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: [As trash is thrown at her] Fluke.
